summary: Gray elevates Illiger’s Proboscidea family to an order. He recognizes and describes two proboscidean species named by Cuvier, Elephas indicus and Mastodon giganteum, and coins the family name Elephantidae for the former and Mastodontadae for the latter.
title: On the Natural Arrangement of Vertebrose Animals.
